comment: Love Professor Gravitt!! She is so caring and understanding. There was a lot of reading but it wasn't hard at all she's a really lenient grader. She cares more about you learning than anything else. She'll also work with you if you can't get the work done on time. Take her!!!

Professor Gravitt made taking an English class very manageable and fun. Although attendance isn't necessary, going to class didn't feel like a chore. She made class enjoyable and has a great personality.

Class assignments are pretty much all online and not difficult but quizzes were in-person and handwritten (quite easy!). Minimal reading material. Most of your grade relies on the major assignments such as essays, but she walks you through everything and is very easy to talk to. Take advantage of the KSU writing center for easy extra credit points!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: You have to read a lot of texts. There's a written response quiz each week. DO NOT CHEAT. She is very strict about cheating and will report you if you do. There's a discussion board every week, 250 words, and a 100-word response to 2 people. There are two big assignments, a midterm and Final test, and a final presentation. Very tough grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is honestly a great person. She's silly and if you ask questions shell always help. Attendance is necessary because everyday there is an in class activity that's usually quite easy

Prof. Gravitt is awesome. Very little big projects to work on outside of class. Not lecture heavy. Easy to reach via email, and provides one no questions asked extention and lots of extra credit opportunities. Four big assignments: Annotated Bib, Research Proposal, Final paper, Presentation.  Easy class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing teacher for an online lit class. The work for the semester is laid out very clearly, and it's a very organized class. Mostly just readings, quizzes over the readings, and discussions. There are two pretty big assignments, but very easy. Quizzes are extremely easy; just genuinely read the readings, and you'll pass easily. Great professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Really nice, accommodating, helps you out if you're stuck on something.

Very easy class. all assignments are online, can email outside of class, worked well with SDS, no tests 3 papers and a final presentation. weekly work but none of it is challenging, 100% recommend. hardest part about the class is opening D2L and getting the motivation to actually do the work.

She's a really good professor that makes her expectations clear. You have a lot of creative freedom in this class and she gives good feedback. The only thing that got me sometimes was responding to other people's discussion posts and doing the work on the hybrid days. 9/10 would take her class again :)
Proffesor Gravitt is great. She is very patient and wants her students to succeed. She is also a very nice woman when you talk to her. Her office hours are helpful as well. Take her class!

She is very sweet and grades well, but the course has a heavy weekly workload. There are a few big writing assignments, but she breaks down the process which is helpful. You have to dedicate a couple of hours for this class every week to keep up.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Gravitt is really kind and teaches the material well. There is a semester long research project but she helps you with all the steps along the way. Each week has a discussion post with reply's to others, a quick assignment, and some readings or a podcast to review. No textbooks required.
Shes really nice. and not a tough grader
Very nice, very easy to work with.

Professor Gravitt was amazing. She always made sure we all were on the right track and gave us help anytime we needed. She does peer review workshops with every essay which made it much easier to write our papers. She is so kind and patient, and I would recommend her to anyone.

She does a great job communicating with her students and class consists of discussion posts, responding to peers, and a big final project with deadlines. She basically let us write about whatever we wanted so pick something interesting so research is fun. She tends to be lenient with deadlines.
One of the nicest professors I've taken!

I took Dr Gravitt in the fall of 2021 so some of these things may have changed, but she was a very easy professor to take. Attendance was not mandatory due to COVID safety. Occasional discussion posts but most of your grade comes from three research papers that she is very willing to help you with should you have questions
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Gravitt is the sweetest professor I've met! Her classes and grading creteria are straight forward and clear. She doesn't grade too harshly, and we had 3 papers to write throughout the semester. She responded to her emails well and was easily accessible outside her classrooms as well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor. Easy to get in touch with &many office hours. Class is based of research topic you pick at the beginning of the semester. No tests but multiple research activities and mini papers that all lead up to one final researched argument paper and powerpoint presentation. If you have the chance I highly recommend taking Professor Gravitt.

Prof Gravitt is the move tbh. Her class is straightforward and if you put in some work you will have good results. Easy A, just be prepared to know how to write. If you can write you will pass this class with an A no problem.

I took her online class over the summer and it was extremely easy! The workload wasn't heavy and I was able to complete my assignments in a timely manner. She's one of the best professors I've ever had at Kennesaw. If you put in hard work, she WILL make sure you get an A. She even gives students extra credit if you work diligently.
Great personality, really wakes you up I think. She is very respectful of your time if you are respectful of hers.

Professor Gravitt was the best teacher I've ever had. I don't usually enjoy English, but her class ended up being my favorite. I actually learned a lot and the topics we discussed were relevant and enjoyable. Take her class if you can!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Super nice and caring. Provides readings in PDF or link form. Super willing to work with you, with clear grading. She'll even help you revise your paper before you turn it in.

Honestly, The best english teacher yet! She truly cares about her students and gives good feedback on writing assignments. She works with you and truly wants you to pass. If youre not the best at writing she will make sure at the end you have improved. Also she replies to emails very quickly and gives you a couple of passes on attendance. TAKE HER
She is really chill just do your papers and discussions and u will be fine.

Professor Gravitt was a fantastic English Professor. She is very understanding, and we only had to complete three papers. The rest of her assignments were very straightforward to complete. Lastly, she has a good grading policy and does try to help you better your writing.

She is truly a great professor, I even signed up to take her comp 1102 class over the summer. Is very accommodating and genuinely cares about her students. Fair grader on papers, theres 3, and a presentation at the end of the semester. If you have the chance to take her, do!

She is a very good professor who gives us interesting thought provoking content and she has a very playful and entertaining teaching style in which she maintains the attention of her students during class.

I have already registered to take her for ENGL1102. Took it asynchronous, but she has straight forward assignments with fun "readings" (podcast, Talkshows, comics) that you use as documents for your final paper. Plus, everything you do in class is a 100 for simply participating. You're preventing an easy A and great teacher if you don't take her.

I took this class last semester in 2021. Great professor! Really kind and nice. Great class and learned a lot. Didn't pick on people to talk during class discussions. The only downside is the grammar presentation and presenting. Will have to present twice in this class.

She will work with you around mental/general health related problems and very kind. Excellent in class discussions, engaging and easy to access outside of office/class hours. Obviously, LGBTQ+ friendly, feminist but refreshingly unbias. This class taught me how to write a citation by hand & opened my mind a little more. Goes by first name: Chill af

Incredibly kind professor. Really cared about students writing success and focused more on students' specific struggles. Very understanding and lenient if you missed an assignment. Consisted of three essays which were fairly easy and fun to write. Very great class and prof.

She lets you write your research paper on whatever you want. Some of the content of the readings on D2L was uncomfortable, but she used them to explain the technical aspects of academic writing. She's willing to work with you if you get sick or have computer problems. She's also good at explaining things and I loved working on my paper. Great prof!

She is very kind. The course has three papers, two projects, and assignments that will count as your attendance. The course is pretty easy if you are a strong writer. She provides feedback on your assignments so you will know where you need to improve. You just have to do the assignments to pass the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gravitt is a great professor, she is very caring and compassionate, she doesn't penalized you harshly for missing work, due dates are somewhat flexible if you just meet with her and talk to her she would work with you, she checks up on her students regularly to she how your doing, Hands down my favorite professor so far.

Professor Gravitt is probably one of the nicest people I've ever met. She doesn't just treat you like you're one of her students, she treats you like a human being and a friend. She truly wants you to pass and cares deeply about your wellbeing, and responds very quickly when you reach out. You'll really learn in this class. Take her if you can!
best professor ever!! if you can take her class TAKE IT. shes so nice and actually tries to help you pass!

Shes really caring and nice, she takes time to help us with any questions and is really understanding about giving extra time for assignments! Her classes arent boring and youll only use the textbook once for an assignment
